case_vignette: A 70-year-old man is brought to the emergency department because of severe back pain that began when he was lifting a box 1 hour ago. He also has a 2-year history of increasingly severe right hip pain. Physical examination shows tenderness to palpation of the lower spine as well as erythema of the skin over the right hip. Neurologic examination shows decreased hearing in the left ear; the Weber test localizes to the left side. Serum studies show an alkaline phosphatase concentration of 410 U/L, calcium concentration of 9.5 mg/dL, and parathyroid hormone level of 322 pg/mL. An x-ray of the spine shows a fracture of the L4 vertebra.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Endocrinology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got severe back pain that started when I was lifting a box an hour ago and my right hip has been hurting more and more for the last two years.
How old are you?
I am 70 years old.
Have you experienced any changes in your weight recently?
The vignette doesn't mention any changes in my weight.
Do you have a history of osteoporosis or fractures?
The vignette doesn't mention a history of osteoporosis, but I do have a fracture in my lower spine.
Do you have a family history of osteoporosis or bone fractures?
The vignette doesn't provide information about my family history.
Are you currently taking any medications for osteoporosis or any other medical condition?
The vignette doesn't mention any medications that I am taking.
**Final Diagnosis:** Osteoporotic Vertebral Compression Fracture
